Sentencas: A Ni-samaria-doped ceria (SDC) anode is employed for direct electrochemical oxidation of methane in a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) with yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) as electrolyte to seek insights into the properties and electrocatalytic activity of the anode.
Titulo: Study of Ni-samaria-doped ceria anode for direct oxidation of methane in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Compared with Ni-YSZ, the Ni-SDC anode exhibits higher open-circuit voltages (OCVs) and a lower degree of polarization.
Titulo: Study of Ni-samaria-doped ceria anode for direct oxidation of methane in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The anodic polarization of Ni-SDC is shown to result from the effect of concentration polarization.
Titulo: Study of Ni-samaria-doped ceria anode for direct oxidation of methane in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The effect of nickel content in Ni-SDC on the performance and microstructure of the anode are studied.
Titulo: Study of Ni-samaria-doped ceria anode for direct oxidation of methane in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: It is found that the anodic polarization and electrocatalytic activity strongly depend on the Ni content in the anode, and optimum results are achieved with 60 wt.% Ni.
Titulo: Study of Ni-samaria-doped ceria anode for direct oxidation of methane in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The good performance of this Ni-SDC anode appears to be due to its microstructure.
Titulo: Study of Ni-samaria-doped ceria anode for direct oxidation of methane in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In addition, the anode is stable in a methane environment.
Titulo: Study of Ni-samaria-doped ceria anode for direct oxidation of methane in solid oxide fuel cells
